title: What are the advantages and disadvantages of taking SAT exam? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m not sure I really understand why you ask this. But if a college or university requires the exam, or the ACT, then you must take it to be considered for admissions. There are always some exceptional cases if you live in a yurt in Mongolia, I suppose. There are many test optional colleges that will allow your other attributes to shine. Even for these, if you do will on the tests, you should submit it. https://www.fairtest.org/university/optional

One advantage of the SAT (or ACT for that matter) is that it kind of levels the playing field for college admissions due to the fact that there are great differences in U.S. high schools when it comes to grading and difficulty of courses. Neither test is perfect, however. I remember one student who only scored a 21 on her ACT, but received almost all A’s in college.
